executive_summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company - world's largest semiconductor foundry. Potential modern infrastructure control strategy similar to Operation Mockingbird (media control) but for chips (physical infrastructure control).
key_findings: Founded 1987 in Taiwan with zero prior semiconductor industry
Morris Chang (founder) worked at Texas Instruments 25 years
By 2020s: 92% of world's advanced chip manufacturing
Creates strategic dependence: global chip reliance = Taiwan defense guarantee
concealment_strategy: Hidden in plain sight: Public company with obscured strategic origins. Question: Was dominance planned (strategic infrastructure control) or organic growth?
